trans-unit.source: If you enable customers to use your app for free during a trial period, you can entice your customers to upgrade to the full version of your app by excluding or limiting some features during the trial period.
trans-unit.target: If you enable customers to use your app for free during a trial period, you can entice your customers to upgrade to the full version of your app by excluding or limiting some features during the trial period.

trans-unit.source: Exclude or limit features in a trial version
trans-unit.target: Exclude or limit features in a trial version

trans-unit.source: Exclude or limit features in a trial version
trans-unit.target: Exclude or limit features in a trial version

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: If you enable customers to use your app for free during a trial period, you can entice your customers to upgrade to the full version of your app by excluding or limiting some features during the trial period.
trans-unit.target: If you enable customers to use your app for free during a trial period, you can entice your customers to upgrade to the full version of your app by excluding or limiting some features during the trial period.

trans-unit.source: Determine which features should be limited before you begin coding, then make sure that your app only allows them to work when a full license has been purchased.
trans-unit.target: Determine which features should be limited before you begin coding, then make sure that your app only allows them to work when a full license has been purchased.

trans-unit.source: You can also enable features, such as banners or watermarks, that are shown only during the trial, before a customer buys your app.
trans-unit.target: You can also enable features, such as banners or watermarks, that are shown only during the trial, before a customer buys your app.

trans-unit.source: Let's look at how to add this to your app.
trans-unit.target: Let's look at how to add this to your app.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: A Windows app in which to add features for customers to buy.
trans-unit.target: A Windows app in which to add features for customers to buy.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Pick the features you want to enable or disable during the trial period
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Pick the features you want to enable or disable during the trial period

trans-unit.source: The current license state of your app is stored as properties of the [**LicenseInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225157) class.
trans-unit.target: The current license state of your app is stored as properties of the [**LicenseInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225157) class.

trans-unit.source: Typically, you put the functions that depend on the license state in a conditional block, as we describe in the next step.
trans-unit.target: Typically, you put the functions that depend on the license state in a conditional block, as we describe in the next step.

trans-unit.source: When considering these features, make sure you can implement them in a way that will work in all license states.
trans-unit.target: When considering these features, make sure you can implement them in a way that will work in all license states.

trans-unit.source: Also, decide how you want to handle changes to the app's license while the app is running.
trans-unit.target: Also, decide how you want to handle changes to the app's license while the app is running.

trans-unit.source: Your trial app can be full-featured, but have in-app ad banners where the paid-for version doesn't.
trans-unit.target: Your trial app can be full-featured, but have in-app ad banners where the paid-for version doesn't.

trans-unit.source: Or, your trial app can disable certain features, or display regular messages asking the user to buy it.
trans-unit.target: Or, your trial app can disable certain features, or display regular messages asking the user to buy it.

trans-unit.source: Think about the type of app you're making and what a good trial or expiration strategy is for it.
trans-unit.target: Think about the type of app you're making and what a good trial or expiration strategy is for it.

trans-unit.source: For a trial version of a game, a good strategy is to limit the amount of game content that a user can play.
trans-unit.target: For a trial version of a game, a good strategy is to limit the amount of game content that a user can play.

trans-unit.source: For a trial version of a utility, you might consider setting an expiration date, or limiting the features that a potential buyer can use.
trans-unit.target: For a trial version of a utility, you might consider setting an expiration date, or limiting the features that a potential buyer can use.

trans-unit.source: For most non-gaming apps, setting an expiration date works well, because users can develop a good understanding of the complete app.
trans-unit.target: For most non-gaming apps, setting an expiration date works well, because users can develop a good understanding of the complete app.

trans-unit.source: Here are a few common expiration scenarios and your options for handling them.
trans-unit.target: Here are a few common expiration scenarios and your options for handling them.

trans-unit.source: Trial license expires while the app is running
trans-unit.target: Trial license expires while the app is running

trans-unit.source: If the trial expires while your app is running, your app can:
trans-unit.target: If the trial expires while your app is running, your app can:

trans-unit.source: Do nothing.
trans-unit.target: Do nothing.

trans-unit.source: Display a message to your customer.
trans-unit.target: Display a message to your customer.

trans-unit.source: Close.
trans-unit.target: Close.

trans-unit.source: Prompt your customer to buy the app.
trans-unit.target: Prompt your customer to buy the app.

trans-unit.source: The best practice is to display a message with a prompt for buying the app, and if the customer buys it, continue with all features enabled.
trans-unit.target: The best practice is to display a message with a prompt for buying the app, and if the customer buys it, continue with all features enabled.

trans-unit.source: If the user decides not to buy the app, close it or remind them to buy the app at regular intervals.
trans-unit.target: If the user decides not to buy the app, close it or remind them to buy the app at regular intervals.

trans-unit.source: Trial license expires before the app is launched
trans-unit.target: Trial license expires before the app is launched

trans-unit.source: If the trial expires before the user launches the app, your app won't launch.
trans-unit.target: If the trial expires before the user launches the app, your app won't launch.

trans-unit.source: Instead, users see a dialog box that gives them the option to purchase your app from the Store.
trans-unit.target: Instead, users see a dialog box that gives them the option to purchase your app from the Store.

trans-unit.source: Customer buys the app while it is running
trans-unit.target: Customer buys the app while it is running

trans-unit.source: If the customer buys your app while it is running, here are some actions your app can take.
trans-unit.target: If the customer buys your app while it is running, here are some actions your app can take.

trans-unit.source: Do nothing and let them continue in trial mode until they restart the app.
trans-unit.target: Do nothing and let them continue in trial mode until they restart the app.

trans-unit.source: Thank them for buying or display a message.
trans-unit.target: Thank them for buying or display a message.

trans-unit.source: Silently enable the features that are available with a full-license (or disable the trial-only notices).
trans-unit.target: Silently enable the features that are available with a full-license (or disable the trial-only notices).

trans-unit.source: If you want to detect the license change and take some action in your app, you must add an event handler for this as described in the next step.
trans-unit.target: If you want to detect the license change and take some action in your app, you must add an event handler for this as described in the next step.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Initialize the license info
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Initialize the license info

trans-unit.source: When your app is initializing, get the [**LicenseInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225157) object for your app as shown in this example.
trans-unit.target: When your app is initializing, get the [**LicenseInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225157) object for your app as shown in this example.

trans-unit.source: We assume that **licenseInformation** is a global variable or field of type **LicenseInformation**.
trans-unit.target: We assume that **licenseInformation** is a global variable or field of type **LicenseInformation**.

trans-unit.source: Initialize the [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) or [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) to access the app's license info.
trans-unit.target: Initialize the [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) or [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) to access the app's license info.

trans-unit.source: Add an event handler to receive notifications when the license changes while the app is running.
trans-unit.target: Add an event handler to receive notifications when the license changes while the app is running.

trans-unit.source: The app's license could change if the trial period expires or the customer buys the app through a Store, for example.
trans-unit.target: The app's license could change if the trial period expires or the customer buys the app through a Store, for example.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Code the features in conditional blocks
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Code the features in conditional blocks

trans-unit.source: When the license change event is raised, your app must call the License API to determine if the trial status has changed.
trans-unit.target: When the license change event is raised, your app must call the License API to determine if the trial status has changed.

trans-unit.source: The code in this step shows how to structure your handler for this event.
trans-unit.target: The code in this step shows how to structure your handler for this event.

trans-unit.source: At this point, if a user bought the app, it is a good practice to provide feedback to the user that the licensing status has changed.
trans-unit.target: At this point, if a user bought the app, it is a good practice to provide feedback to the user that the licensing status has changed.

trans-unit.source: You might need to ask the user to restart the app if that's how you've coded it.
trans-unit.target: You might need to ask the user to restart the app if that's how you've coded it.

trans-unit.source: But make this transition as seamless and painless as possible.
trans-unit.target: But make this transition as seamless and painless as possible.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to evaluate an app's license status so that you can enable or disable a feature of your app accordingly.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to evaluate an app's license status so that you can enable or disable a feature of your app accordingly.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Get an app's trial expiration date
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Get an app's trial expiration date

trans-unit.source: Include code to determine the app's trial expiration date.
trans-unit.target: Include code to determine the app's trial expiration date.

trans-unit.source: The code in this example defines a function to get the expiration date of the app's trial license.
trans-unit.target: The code in this example defines a function to get the expiration date of the app's trial license.

trans-unit.source: If the license is still valid, display the expiration date with the number of days left until the trial expires.
trans-unit.target: If the license is still valid, display the expiration date with the number of days left until the trial expires.

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Test the features using simulated calls to the License API
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Test the features using simulated calls to the License API

trans-unit.source: Now, test your app using simulated calls to the license server.
trans-unit.target: Now, test your app using simulated calls to the license server.

trans-unit.source: In JavaScript, C#, Visual Basic, or Visual C++, replace references to [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) with [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) in the app's initialization code.
trans-unit.target: In JavaScript, C#, Visual Basic, or Visual C++, replace references to [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) with [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) in the app's initialization code.

trans-unit.source: [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) gets test-specific licensing info from an XML file called "WindowsStoreProxy.xml", located in %userprofile%\\AppData\\local\\packages\\<package name>\\LocalState\\Microsoft\\Windows Store\\ApiData.
trans-unit.target: [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) gets test-specific licensing info from an XML file called "WindowsStoreProxy.xml", located in %userprofile%\\AppData\\local\\packages\\<package name>\\LocalState\\Microsoft\\Windows Store\\ApiData.

trans-unit.source: If this path and file don't exist, you must create them, either during installation or at run-time.
trans-unit.target: If this path and file don't exist, you must create them, either during installation or at run-time.

trans-unit.source: If you try to access the [**CurrentAppSimulator.LicenseInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779768) property without WindowsStoreProxy.xml present in that specific location, you will get an error.
trans-unit.target: If you try to access the [**CurrentAppSimulator.LicenseInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779768) property without WindowsStoreProxy.xml present in that specific location, you will get an error.

trans-unit.source: This example illustrates how you can add code to your app to test it under different licensing states.
trans-unit.target: This example illustrates how you can add code to your app to test it under different licensing states.

trans-unit.source: You can edit WindowsStoreProxy.xml to change the simulated expiration dates for your app and for its features.
trans-unit.target: You can edit WindowsStoreProxy.xml to change the simulated expiration dates for your app and for its features.

trans-unit.source: Test all your possible expiration and licensing configurations to make sure everything works as intended.
trans-unit.target: Test all your possible expiration and licensing configurations to make sure everything works as intended.

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Replace the simulated License API methods with the actual API
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Replace the simulated License API methods with the actual API

trans-unit.source: After you test your app with the simulated license server, and before you submit your app to a Store for certification, replace [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) with [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765), as shown in the next code sample.
trans-unit.target: After you test your app with the simulated license server, and before you submit your app to a Store for certification, replace [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) with [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765), as shown in the next code sample.

trans-unit.source: **Important** Your app must use the [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) object when you submit your app to a Store or it will fail certification.
trans-unit.target: **Important** Your app must use the [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) object when you submit your app to a Store or it will fail certification.

trans-unit.source: Step 7: Describe how the free trial works to your customers
trans-unit.target: Step 7: Describe how the free trial works to your customers

trans-unit.source: Be sure to explain how your app will behave during and after the free trial period so your customers won't be surprised by your app's behavior.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to explain how your app will behave during and after the free trial period so your customers won't be surprised by your app's behavior.

trans-unit.source: For more info about describing your app, see [Create app descriptions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148529).
trans-unit.target: For more info about describing your app, see [Create app descriptions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148529).
